title: Class based kerning not showing up.
content:
I spent several hours over the last couple of days on this one. I thought I would share in case anyone else has this problem. I created a kern feature in FontLab, but upon export the kerning wouldn’t show up in either OSX Cocoa apps or the Adobe apps. When I reimported the exported fonts in FontLab, the kern feature was still there. The solution? For some reason the system wouldn’t show the kern feature unless I added another feature, in this case a simple ligature feature. Go figure.

 [‹ Flowing text across Indesign pages](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202195107/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36508 "Go to previous forum topic") [Positive Kerning ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202195107/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36457 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Christian Robertson

comments.content: I haven’t had this problem - yet. But I am keen to know how to prevent it.
I’ve noticed this too. So I always throw a lig or fractions in to be safe.

I have also heard of this problem. It makes no sense but I always add another feature as well just like you both have.

ChrisL
That gets mentioned from time to time in Build threads. It’s unfortunate you missed those, but props for figuring it out and sharing.

As Nick said, this is a recurrent subject in the Build forum. I’m surprised you missed it.
